BiblioData.Title: Process of Preparing Carbon Nanotube having Improved Conductivity
BiblioData.Abstract: Provided are a method of doping carbon nanotubes, p-doped carbon nanotubes prepared using the method, and an electrode, a display device or a solar cell including the carbon nanotubes. Particularly, a method of doping carbon nanotubes having improved conductivity by reforming the carbon nanotubes using an oxidizer, doped carbon nanotubes prepared using the method, and an electrode, a display device or a solar cell including the carbon nanotubes are provided.

Claims.P: 1. A method of doping carbon nanotubes, the method comprising:
preparing an oxidizer solution comprising an oxidizer and an organic solvent; and
doping carbon nanotubes using the oxidizer solution.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the doping of the carbon nanotubes comprises mixing a carbon nanotube powder with the oxidizer solution and stirring the mixture.
3. The method of claim 1 or 2, wherein the organic solvent promotes dispersion of the carbon nanotubes.

4. The method of any of claims 1-3, wherein the organic solvent is selected from the group consisting of dimethylformamide (DMF), 1,2-dichloro ethane (DCE), 1,2-dichloro benzene (ODCB), nitromethane, tetrahydrofuran (THF), N-methylpyrrolidone (NMP), dimethyl sulfoxide, nitrobenzene butyl nitrite, and a combination comprising at least one of the foregoing organic solvents.
5. The method of any of claims 1-4, wherein the oxidizer solution further comprises a dispersing agent.
6. The method of any of claims 1-5, wherein the doping of the carbon nanotubes comprises dipping or coating a film formed of the carbon nanotubes using the oxidizer solution.
7. The method of any of claims 1-6, wherein the organic solvent has oxidizability.

8. The method of claim 7, wherein the organic solvent having oxidizability is selected from the group consisting of nitromethane, dimethyl sulfoxide, nitrobenzene, butyl nitrite, and a combination comprising at least one of the foregoing solvents.
9. The method of any of claims 1-8, wherein the oxidizer has an oxidation number of at least two.

10. The method of any of claims 1-8, wherein the oxidizer is selected from the group consisting of halogen oxides, sulfur oxides, metal halides, nitrogen oxides, metal oxyacid-based compounds, benzoquinone-based compounds, O3 and H2O2.
11. Doped carbon nanotubes prepared by a method of doping carbon nanotubes according to any of claims 1-10.
12. A film comprising doped carbon nanotubes which has conductivity of less than 10<3> /sq, and an optical transmittance of at least 75%.
13. The film of claim 12, prepared by a method of doping carbon nanotubes according to any of claims 1-10.
14. An electrode comprising doped carbon nanotubes prepared by a method of doping carbon nanotubes according to any of claims 1-10.
15. A thin film transistor comprising doped carbon nanotubes prepared by a method of doping carbon nanotubes according to any of claims 1-10.
